intro: Microlicia hirta, commonly known as the hairy microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
